quizzes.question: Which header file should be included to work with files?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Working with Files[/h1]

Another useful C++ feature is the ability to read and write to files. That requires the standard C++ library called [b]fstream[/b].
Three new data types are defined in fstream:
[b]ofstream[/b]: Output file stream that creates and writes information to files.
[b]ifstream[/b]: Input file stream that reads information from files.
[b]fstream[/b]: General file stream, with both ofstream and ifstream capabilities that allow it to create, read, and write information to files.

To perform file processing in C++, header files <[b]iostream[/b]> and <[b]fstream[/b]> must be included in the C++ source file.[code format="cpp"]#include <iostream>
#include <fstream>[/code]
